Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2013 04:33PM Donna2012 wrote: My Dr. in Phila is the same way. He said that an earlier diagnosis of mets, doesn't change the survival rate. To be honest I am very happy with this. I could not stand the total emotional turmoil I would be under, going in for scans. If I should have any symptoms, I will get tested then. I will know about a recurrence before they will. Going in for office visits are not stressful for me because If I feel good (which I always have), I cannot receive "bad" news.
Posts.Title: east coast doctors fredntan Janetanned

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2013 05:03PM Donna2012 wrote: Sounds like the Phila Drs. think alike!
Posts.Title: east coast doctors fredntan Janetanned

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2013 07:14PM Donna2012 wrote: I did 12 weekly taxol treatments & then 4 treatments of FEC every 3 weeks. My hair thinned on taxol, but I didn't lose it all until I started FEC. The strange thing was that just before the 3rd FEC it began to grow back! That was a big surprise! FEC was much harder for me than taxol. I felt very sick for a couple of days - never actually threw up. The plus side was I did not have to go back for 3 weeks & began to feel good after the 1st week. So, I guess I had 1 bad week & 2 good ones each treatment. Looking back now, I can say it wasn't so bad - but at the time it was just something that I did what I had to, to get it done with.
Posts.Title: Starting FEC for liver mets. Moiralf Moiralf

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2014 06:06PM Donna2012 wrote: I'm having my radiation tattoos removed by laser.  I had the 1st treatment today - I will most likely need 1 or 2 more to have them removed completely.  So happy to be having this done!
Posts.Title: Removal of rads tattoos Tink1966 Donna2012

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2014 08:14AM Donna2012 wrote: I had 12 weekly cycles of taxol (same as docetaxel) followed by 4 cycles, every 3 weeks, of FEC.  FEC was definitely the worse for me.  Taxol was easy in comparison.  However my hair started growing back after my 2nd round of FEC, which was a nice surprise.  At the time, it seemed horrible & time moved sooo slow, but looking back now (9 mos later) it feels like it wasn't too bad and was over with rather quickly.  It did take several mos to begin to feel "normal" again.
Posts.Title: Ladies in your 30's getting FEC-D protocol? calmandstrong robsp

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2013 06:42PM Donna2012 wrote: I had #17 of 25 + 5 boosts today. So far my skin is just slightly "tanned". I am not having any issues - this is WAY easier than chemo! Do you think that if I made it this far, that my skin will be ok - or is it still too early for skin breakdown?
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2013 09:23PM Donna2012 wrote: Just finished #18 of 25 + 5 boosts today. The area is "tanned" and I am just tonight feeling a slight burning feeling, but nothing too bad yet. I am still very comfortable wearing a bra and I do not see any swelling. I need to make an appt for a fitting for a breast prosthesis and was wondering how long after radiation is it safe to do so.
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2014 10:08AM Donna2012 wrote: I too am from your area - warrington.  I researched a lot & went to wig elegance in langhorne.  Very happy - paid about $400 for a nice synthetic wig.  It was written in my insurance policy that "cranium prosthesis" are not covered, however the owner of the store told me that once I receive my denial to appeal it.   She sees people that have a denial overturned about 50% of the time.   I did - it took about 6 mos but they covered the wig 100%!   Also, I know many people shave their heads right away, I didn't and was very happy that I did not.  I started chemo on nov 2nd and for about 2 mos was able to wear a hat that looked nice because I had hair sticking out from under it - it was definitely thinning, but it still looked ok under a hat.  I would say it wasn't until mid-jan that it was almost all gone & I did shave it then.  I started my 2nd chemo - FEC 1/31 & by the 2nd 3 week cycle (to my surprise) the hair began to grow!  It continued growing during the 3rd & 4th chemo round.  So, I wasn't totally bald for really that long.
Posts.Title: Wig shopping in Horsham, PA area birdlover23 Donna2012

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2013 08:50PM Donna2012 wrote: I am applying "Calendula", which is made from crushed marigold flowers, twice ech day. I have rads in the morning, so I apply it right after rads & before bed. I also was told to use Dial soap & I just let the suds from the washcloth drop on the area when i shower, then rinse with cool water. Seems to be working, so far so good!

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2013 04:51PM Donna2012 wrote: #20 today & it is the first time I have noticed some skin breakdown. An area about the size of a penny close to my underarm. The nurse noticed it today & asked if I had any pain. I told her none whatsoever, since that area is numb from surgery! Also for the first time today I feel more tired. My radiation office is closed next thurs & fri, so they are seeing patients this Sunday. So I have off tomorrow, 4 days on and then 4 days off. The break will be nice!
